REVIEW_BODY: We went during the day and visited the domes, forest was the better of the two unless you have a specific interest in flowers. Gift shop nice and lovely just walking through the park. We also went at night to the 7:45 light show - wow, it was brilliant.

We had only just arrived in Singapore and after settling in caught a taxi cross town (taxis are very economical) and arrived at Gardens by the Bay at 9pm. Even in the dark it's an amazing place to visit and there is lighting aplenty. Just stood in awe of the tree structures and gardens.

Along with thousands of other people we walked across to the Marina Bay Sands. Now that is an amazing structure and the place to visit, even if you are not staying there.

On our walk to the Gardens by the Bay we could see them from a great distance, these huge glass "bubbles". The worlds largest glass greenhouses we later learned. I kept on thinking how did they get these enormous trees into the greenhouses. Another thought that passed through my mind how can they keep these "bubble" soooo cold? Yes these greenhouses are cold. Bring a jacket. I also wondering about the inside temperature and the plants well being. Well they seem to be healthy. Anyway it is a must see.

Beautiful flowers
The smell so refreshing and the atmosphere was excellent.
Good to see the flowers from other countries under one roof.

We spent just over 4 hours here due to the fact we were boarding our cruise ship. A full day here is easily done. It's like a rabbit Warren with a hidden gem around every corner. We did all the dimes and the sky walk. By far the best thing we have ever done. Ingenious idea. Theres so much to see and learn about. A must fo for any one visiting Singapore
Simply love the different types of plants and flowers featured from different parts of the world. Love the waterfall.

What an amazing garden this was. There is so much to do and the light show at night is beautiful. We could have spent a whole day here unfortunately we only spent the second half of the day which was ashame as we didn't make it for the outdoor skywalk or enjoy any of the restaurants surrounding. Definitely a must visit when in Singapore!

A visit to Singapore should not miss out a visit to this extraordinary exhibition, The flower dome is spectacular and the vast number of displays wonderful. The layout is very good with lots of information along the way. Water features are fantastic with the wow factor. Definitely worth the money and you can spend as much time as you want.

Gardens by the Bay was probably my favourite thing to see while in Singapore.

At night time with the light show everywhere you look is amazing and a real buzz around the gardens.

Great place to take the kids as they really enjoy the different lights and colours that are on show.

Personally I think it‚Äôs best to just stay in the free zone area and not go up to see views they are just ok.

I would make this a top priority to see while in Singapore and If time permits would go in daytime and nighttime to see the difference in atmosphere.

Having visited three times in three days, this place is brilliant and calming at the same time.
The different areas of the gardens are relaxing (for those who enjoy gardening) but the light show and then the entertainment value of this park is exceptional.

On a negative note!! We bought tickets to go up the Supertree but no one mentioned that there would be a closure on the 20th, so the ticket was invalid and they don‚Äôt do refunds üôÑ, sorry but that‚Äôs poor!!! So we paid $6 more and went up to the higher sections, only to be told AFTER been persuaded to spend the extra money, that, if the weather changed they would be closing the higher deck. üò≥
So sarcastically I did retort that maybe they should have told us all this before selling tickets ....
Another group of people who had bought tickets by an agency had the same problem but they could not pay extra as we had, so walked off disgruntled!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place if you love greens
REVIEW_BODY: Got tickets for floral fantasy , flower dome, cloud forest so might well visit one time. All of three , I think cloud forest is the best. Waterfall and skywalk around the lush greenery is nice. Nice ride at the end of floral fantasy. Flower dome I think is not flowery enough. Overall a nice place to visit

The gardens which surround the two conservatories then Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest are outstandingly beautiful, full of rich tropical plants, flowering shrubs, majestic trees and exotic palms. It‚Äôs a wonderful experience. The Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest are full of gardens of the world set high in towering elegant glass structures through which you see Singapore laid out below. It‚Äôs unforgettable and totally inspiring!

The Gardens by the Bay are not to be missed. The two domed gardens are spectacular. The path are easy to follow and not overly crowded. There are signs identifying each tree or flower. The wood sculptures are unbelievable. The free light show far surpasses going to the Night Safari. The lights dance to the classical music. Get there early for a seat on the steps. Standing and looking up for close to an hour is not comfortable. Hang back or immediately head for the exits as it is very crowded as the area empties. Access to the park is easy from the Bayfront MRT.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spend hours walking this large garden, eat at Satay by the Bay, light show at night
REVIEW_BODY: One could spend hours walking this fabulous free garden (as long as it is not raining). There are places to eat by the domes, but the better place is Satay by the Bay which has many hawker stalls and a large variety of food. Since I had done free garden part of this 5 years ago, I did the other parts this time (the non-free domes and the free light show).

REVIEW_TITLE: Second visit as good as the first
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited a second having first been to Singapore a few years ago. This is unmissable and should be high up your to do list whilst staying over.

The Flower dome was closed when I came, it may be under renovation but the Cloud Dome is still open

Great place for a visit, informative and lots to see. Felt staff were trying to get people to spend money unnecessarily such as on a ‚Äúhalf an hour‚Äù audio golf cart tour in which the guide kept skipping the audio and the tour went for less than 15 minutes. Taxi service was also super expensive to leave in the evening - $50 for only me to travel 4.1km - when I stated that it was a rip off and I‚Äôd walk they negotiated $30 which was still what I‚Äôd consider to be quite a rip off for the distance. For these reasons I cannot rate it 5 stars

We spent half a day here between a cruise and a flight home. It's only a short ride from the Marina Bay Cruise Terminal (where you can leave you luggage). The super trees were super. Early in the day there are fewer people so we really enjoyed the Skyway, Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. It's surprising how huge the domes really are and they have unique displays. It's a pity we couldn't stay until the night time lights.

Everything was amazing, I don't have words to describe the beauty, the calmness and the balance there was in all they have created!!! Especially the night show was above all expectations!!! I couldn't stop taking pictures and videos, all the supertrees singing and dancing and in the background the spectaculous Marina Bay Sands!!!!
The light show was beautiful. We sat near the grass area and enjoyed the music and lights. A must see if in Singapore

Very relaxing tranquil spot in the city.
The audio bus tour was a bit pricey for what you got and the gardens are a very large space for anyone who has mobility challenges. Any shuttles we saw were not able to pick us up.
Also, we had spent some time there and wanted to have a nice lunch between touring the two main exhibits and we were not able to find a restaurant. We asked every employee we saw and were directed to walk here, walk there, restaurant was closed for special function, more walking, more shuttles that would not assist with a ride, more employees that couldn‚Äôt assist with food directions.
We eventually left with only visiting one of the exhibits, but when we returned the following morning they did honour our ticket from the previous day.
All in all it is a lovely place and I believe they have a nice evening light show which we didn‚Äôt see.
Best to buy all tickets together rather than audio tour separately as we did. You would save a little money.
Loved these beautiful gardens especially the Cloud Forrest. Retuned in the evening as well for the beautiful light show.

Don‚Äôt miss the light show in gardens by the bay. Every evening.
We saw the Garden waltz- it was enchanting and amazing.
See the garden in daytime, too.
A spectacular and beautiful setting the light show was an amazing experience for us to see and hear. You can take some amazing pictures with the sights

Fantastic garden with an amazing collection of plants and trees. Very clean and family friendly. Kids will definitely enjoy the water play area whilst the elderly will enjoy the fantastic and delicious satay by the bay..highly recommended to all..
This is an unique experience for the whole family. The Cloud forest and Flower dome were exceptional! The Flower fantasy also incredible!

The gardens outside are for free, including the Forest grove but you have to pay for the flower dome ($23, or $28 for dome and cloud forest). Plenty of restful places in the gardens, but a fair way from the Bayfront MRT, so you'll get a fair bit of exercise! The flower dome was a lot of a scrum when we were there, especially if you try and work your way around the masses of tourists wanting to spend ages taking pictures of their nearest and dearest in specific locations. There is a lot to see here if you have an interest in horticulture.
All very pleasant-glorious flower displays ending with 4D simulator ride as a dragonfly in the gardens. Gentle and entertaining. Good thing to avoid midday heat or torrential rain...
This really was an excellent light show. We went there s part of a tour group, which was good as we got a bus straight there, and the guide found us a good spot to see the show.
Awsome experience. Very lovely and huge. Enjoyed Cloud forest and Flower Dome. Recommend Cloud Forest and Floral Fantasy.
Very nice place to visit. You can spend 2 hours with your family there. Some places are free to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: A little cheesy but it‚Äôs free
REVIEW_BODY: The teen enjoyed photo ops. Very Disneyland-esque (think It‚Äôs a Small World.) Worth seeing once but not twice. Hey, it‚Äôs free!
Beautiful. Loved the night light show. Air conditioned beauty and nature. Incredible how they have constructed this,

As a nature lover and also an admirer of the quality (and efficiency) of Singaporean attractions, I may be biased but you'd be hard pressed to find anyone who wouldn't have been impressed by the scale and the attention to detail at this attraction. At a entry cost of S$28- you get to spend as long as you like (half a day should do) wondering through the flora and fauna indigenous to all continents with manmade sculptures and features seamlessly woven in. To say I was blown away would be an understatement! Please do yourself a favour and visit this attraction - you will not be disappointed. Highly recommend.
We arrived at the park a little late, around six. The flower dome has some incredible orchids on display and was cooling and refreshing. The light show was great, we missed the overhead skywalk.
You can spend a whole day here! The 2 main domes are cool and interesting and the sky-dome walk is amazing. Excellent variety of plants from around the world. Easy walking. Food outlets are limited.

These gardens are stunning and definitely worth a visit. We originally planned to spend a couple of hours walking round and visiting the two domes, but in the end it was so interesting we probably spent over four hours here.

Spend money or not. It you are interested in just walking around the grounds there is no cost associated with that. Money spent on the cloud forest and other attractions is money well spent. Recommended.

Display of seasonal flowers around the world, also an area for kids
Nice and cool inside, relaxing and easy walk
It takes about an hour depending on your interest level
We bought bundled visit of Flower Dome and Cloud Forest for SGD$28

its really amazing how they have made this . the entire attraction is splendid and one can take some nice selfies here. vibrant and brilliant colours of flowers on display. the waterfall is itself an attraction.
There is literally nowhere in the world like Gardens By The Bay! Fabulous kids playgrounds, gorgeous exhibitions and brilliant and enchanting light show! A must visit when you're in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE FOR THE ENTIRE FAMILY
REVIEW_BODY: This famous super tree structures offer an impressive skywalk over the gardens. Worthwhile visit in afternoon and evening for light show which their are two timings. General walk through gardens is no cost, however, to do anything else or visit other areas, there will,be a fee.

Really enjoyed walking around the different gardens and conservatories(Flower dome and cloud forest). There were many many species of different flora and fauna. They have different themes from time to time which gives you a different experience every time you visit. This is a good place for families, friends and couples. An attraction not to be missed!

REVIEW_TITLE: BEautiful, cool domes and landscaping in the city
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited both the Flower and Cloud domes and found them surprisingly uncrowded. Plenty of flora to admire, orchids being the foremost plants at this time of year. Excellent layout and trickle through pathways meant you could take your time and loop back around. Air con works superbly so a great retreat from the heat. Very interesting information dotted about.

Floral fantasy a little further way from the centre but well worth the hike or shuttle. A small area with floral decorations and interpretations followed by the finale of a 4d film following the path of a dragonfly.....non moving seats on request for those of us with motion sickness

Walking around the clevelry desigined trditonal gardens before going to the tree area was a quiet way to spend some time.

Trees in centre impressive but have left a visit to the observation deck and walkway plus lighting up at night for another day. We spent 6 hours doing everything else as it was !

The gardens and flower domes provide a spectacular array of flowers and plants from all around the world. We particularly enjoyed the Floral Fantasy special exhibit as the colours were amazing. The 4D ride at the end was fun and gave us an idea of what to expect in the rest of the park.
Awesome light show and things to do. This place provides a great experience for all ages with some stunning views of Singapore and iconic Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
Really enjoyed walking around the gardens but the conservatories were the highlight. Our favourite part was the waterfall.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the amazing gardens of the world
REVIEW_BODY:
Excellent Huge and inspiring differing plant zones and features.
It can be crowded so pick your times and wading past "selfies" will be the worse feature. The plants are amazing and the structure impressive

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best places to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: We visited the Gardens at the Bay twice during our stay in Singapore, in the daytime and in the evening for the light show. The gardens are free to visit but there is an admission charge to each of the Cloud Forest, Flower Dome and Floral Fantasy plus the overhead walkway and the observatory. They are all very well worth a visit, our favourites were the Cloud Forest and Floral Fantasy. The evening light show is well worth a visit and can be viewed for free from ground level. There is lots to see and do for the whole family. Highly recommended
The best place ..outstanding flowers.iam very happy to visit this .and the adventure in the buldieng

Amazing show, all for free. Google said there is a cost but to just delight there was none.

It‚Äôs really cool.

Some of the most beautiful botanical gardens I've ever seen. The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are amazing. Great variety of plants and the structure is incredible. You can easily spend half a day there.
Definitely worth a trip during the day and at night. Entrance in to the gardens is free. You only have to pay to do the super tree walk or go into either of the domes.

The gardens are free, greenhouses and trams charge admission. Not well organized, had to go to three different ticket booths to get tickets to both greenhouses and the autonomous tram. Tremendous diversity of plants, the very limited signage appeared to be done by middle school teachers rather than scientists. The plastic and steel ‚Äúplants‚Äù were a bit hokey (really ‚Äúsuper trees‚Äù).

Very impressive! I would recommend to visit the flower and cloud domes during midday hours and stroll around the remainder of the park during daylight. The floral fantasy attraction should not be missed as well. If you are planning to book tickets for the observatory I would advise two things, first, no need to get tickets for the skywalk as the observatory will be much better views and will suffice. Second, go to the observatory just before sunset, the views are breathtaking, the wind is refreshing, and you get to see the gardens transform with the amazing lighting they have. Don't miss the light and music show at 7:45 & 8:45 pm.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not bad but i'd rather do the Cloud forest
REVIEW_BODY: Nice asortment of flowers but I would really recommend going next door to the Cloud Forest. Spend more of your time there

REVIEW_TITLE: MRT station to Garden By the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Alight from Station Bayfront MRT and walk to Garden By The Bay, this stretch of walk is not sheltered and can be quite hot when it is bright sunny day. Garden By The Bay is free entrance, but there are 2 conservatories that need ticket to enter, Flower Dome & Cloud Forest. Certain areas are quite cooling, elderly might need extra clothing.

Visited here twice during our short stay, once during the day and once for the spectacular light show...NOT TO BE MISSED. You could spend days here and not see everything! Fantastic amount of plants and information, we didn‚Äôt have time for either of the domes but the night time show was awe inspiring, moving and something I feel really privileged to have seen, this and walking around the gardens is all free.

You can walk around these gardens, but to go into the pavilions you need to pay. They are wonderful and inspirational and really worth the visit. The quality of the exhibits is very high and they provide a broad spectrum of international flora. It is breathtaking.

This is an excellently developed I can say digital park unique structures that light up in the night the river fill up with colourful baloon like structures.
Nice place to spend couple of hours well connected to the MRT for easier commute
We had the best day cruising around the gardens. Even though it was busy you didn't feel like a sardine in a can. It is truly spectacular and we highly recommend it
The most beautiful amazing place, words can't describe. The cloud dome was out of this world. A complete must see.

It was quite easy to buy tickets around 3. 30pm. We bought for 2 pavilions only.
The exhibits were varied and interesting. There is a lot of walking involved and there is something there for everyone.
Many photographs were taken, the grand waterfall admired and the artwork enjoyed.
A very pleasant afternoon out.
Anthony Wilson.

The Gardens by the Bay was always top of the to do list in Singapore and it didnt disappoint. We walked over from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and it was stunning. It had just gonevdark when we arrived, the gtove trees lookedcstunning with the water fountains and glowing egg shapes around them in the river. The light show was spectacular. We fid not pay for any extras as we thought it wasnt needed. We were only in Singapore for 36hrs so only had one chsnce to see and very glad we did. I could have spent a full day here.

Gardens by the Bay is by now almost a 'must see' destination in Singapore, and we thoroughly enjoyed our daytime visit. I say daytime because others who have visited the place say the nighttime light shows are even better. The 'supertrees' are metallic structures which have been vegetalized, and a sky walkway some 25 meters above the ground connects two of them and offers great views of the Gardens and the Marina Bay Sands complex. The flower dome is billed as the largest greenhouse in the world - large it is indeed, and nicely cool as well, and the geographically themed parts of the dome very nice. We preferred the cloud forest, another greenhouse with an artificial 35 m high waterfall - you can walk up on a spiral walkway from ground level to the top...

Finally been here with my friends, we really enjoy the scenery and mostly the waterfall inside Cloud Forest. It's really cold inside the dome but refreshing so I like it very much. Maybe sometime I will comeback here at night to enjoy the other scenery and the lights too.

We had a great time at the Gardens by the Bay, especially exploring the domes. It‚Äôs pretty hot outside so it was hard to enjoy the gardens as much as we might have otherwise. Nevertheless, they are amazing.

We have been here two times. The flower dome is beautiful and colorful especially with different theme each time.

The cloud forest was awesome and it was cold there. There is a beautiful indoor waterfall. The types of plant change from broad leaf to coniferous type as you climb up the levels in the dome. There are carnivorous plants for display as well.

The supertrees are so huge and are lit up in the night. The skyway gives a lovely view of the garden and supertrees. There are free light and sound shows at 7:45 p.m. and 8:45 p.m. at the supertrees everyday.

The best part for kids is the children‚Äôs gardens where they can play with water in small fountains. Kids will enjoy to their fullest here.

The light show was excellent, they have a few at separate times, we did the 7.45pm show.
A lot of people but the taxis & the buses were well organised in shambolic traffic so arriving and leaving was fine, take a cab if you can or go with an organised tour.
To me the highlights were the visit to the two domes, you had to pay an entrance fee but they were excellent.

We enjoyed it so much. You can visit them just to make a walk and enjoy the fantastic show with the trees ( at 19:45 & 20:45 every day) which is free of charge. Instead, along with the walk you can visit a variety of sightseeing such as the CLoud Forest , the Flower Dome and the OCBC Skywalk.

Few people can adequately describe the stunning beauty of the Gardens by the Bay and I am certainly not one of them just know it is a must see. We purchased the garden tour package which included admissions to the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, and a 20 minute audio tour on a tram going by the art sculptures, Supertree grove, and outdoor gardens.
The Flower Dome was the largest glass greenhouse in the world. According to the guidebook, ‚Äúit replicates a cool-dry climate featuring plants from the Mediterranean and semi-arid and semi-tropical areas in the world‚Äù. There were also beautiful floral Christmas displays throughout.
The Cloud Forest displayed the ‚Äúcool moist climate of the tropical highlands of Southeast Asia, tropical America and Africa. The 35 foot cascading waterfall with plants on the wall was breathtaking.

Was a beautiful experience overall and a perfect place for a family visit. The flower dome, cloud forest, the far east kids playground, the supertrees and the rest of the gardens are a must-do while in Singapore. Save a full day to experience the whole area if travelling with kids. Perfect spot for some memorable photographs.

What a fantastic free attraction. The Gardens By The Bay are probably the best gardens that we have visited in the world and are free to walk around. The Sky walk was excellent value for money. At night the light displays are out of this world. A short walk back to the marina on new years eve and we were treated to a fantastic firework display that seemed to go on forever (from 21:30hrs to 00:20hrs and all free to view.

Don‚Äôt miss it! A true gem with plants from every continent in the world. I did the Floral Fantasy and Dome and enjoyed it thoroughly. I had heard of this garden and seen pictures but it was better than I had expected

It‚Äôs a delightful place, but all the best bits are free.
The Sky Walk is pretty short, crowded and no big deal.
The temperate (?) flower dome is full of daft lego exhibits.

Inspiring! With the supertree grove in particular, stunning garden with loss to check out. Great establishment with restaurants, downside is that different attraction got its individual ticketing. Waste quite a lot of time just to line up.

This place was absolutely amazing , what a treat. We arrived at 4pm and walked around took pictures then we got dinner. After dinner walked over to Sands Skypark Observation Deck which is 52 floors up. The view of the park looking down was so cool.

Then when it became dark all the lights came on!! It is difficult to describe how beautiful it looked. This is something you need to see if you are visiting Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: GBTB is Singapore to a T
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful clean gardens, we have been to the flower dome, floral fantasy, super tree grove and Cloud forest and would recommend them all!!
Amazing Building, all good if you like flowers. Maybe alittle overcrowded when we visited over New Years

Towering man-made structures adorned with flowers and greenery - truly amazing and well worth a visit. Take the elevator to the suspended walkway, and be prepared to be amazed. A bit scary for those afraid of heights!
We were disappointed with this as most of the area's were cleared for replanting, if we had been told when we bought the ticket we wouldn't have bothered

REVIEW_TITLE: Surpassed our high expectations - a MUST SEE
REVIEW_BODY: We visited with our family (ranging from 80s to 18). All of us loved this place. Incredibly well-done and amazing that they were able to build and keep this so wonderfully maintained. We are not big garden aficinados, but everyone enjoyed looking at the various plants, trees, waterfalls, and designs.
Great place to visit. I am not really into gardens but wow. The flower dome and cloud forest were great as was the light show. Well Worth the visit.

Very nice,peaceful, clean area. Beautiful garden with large collection of flowers and tree all over the world. Flower Dome, Cloud forest, Floral fantasy and Super grove (lightshow 7:45pm) tree is a must visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to spend a couple of hours
REVIEW_BODY:
I really enjoy the Gardens by the Bay. The Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are very beautiful. It is great that they change the displays often.

If you are cold natured, I recommend taking a light sweater or jacket with you, as it is quite chilly in both the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest climatrons.
Was there for whole day , loved every bit of it.flower dome/cloud forest /super grove tree , laser lights at the evening ...worth every bit of time.
A really lovely place to visit out of the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautiful gardens and an amazing setting. If in Singapore in December then the Xmas lights cannot be missed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best part of the Singapore vacation
REVIEW_BODY: Really nice area to walk around in. The indoor gardens are fantastic. We wnt up in the trees and the view from above is really great. We also stayed to watch the show in the evening and it was amazing. Highly recommended to spend a full day at Gardens by the bay.

A visit to Singapore would really be incomplete without visiting the famous Gardens by the Bay at the Marina Bay.
This is so beautiful and the lighting is amazing.
Only downfall is the lack of staff around that can direct you - whilst there are plenty of signs it gets rather confusing.
Also, the escalators were not working and people with strollers and wheelchairs were having great difficulty getting up and down.

Great visit to Gardens by the bay. Do not miss OCBC skyway and the show, first one is at 7:45pm, music and lights in the trees.
I think that other attractions last admission is at 8pm, so leave the show to the end. There are restaurants in the area.
To leave there are taxis but count with a big queue.

Since we reached late in the evening, we could not explore the attraction completely. However, there were still so many options for walking through that this really must rank amongst the top in any tourist itinerary of Singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice gardens but not choice to eat
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are nice but they should improve restaurant choices. They are very cheap and bad food except for one which is obv often full.

REVIEW_TITLE: Love both indoor dome and outdoor garden
REVIEW_BODY: Great place to relax and enjoy the scenery. Some people do jogging there in the evening, can be place for dating. Near to Marina Bay Sands and always have a thematic decoration during Christmas or other celebration

REVIEW_TITLE: Tranquility in Singapore's Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Excellent gardens. The flowers and cloud domes are a must. Fantastic flora and fauna showing of the colour, sent and diversity of our planet. Excellent experience and education about the importance of our diverse plant life and the delicate balance of nature. The messages of client change and the ability for us to avoid disaster is both educational and clever in its message. A great place to chill (in the air con domes) and enjoy nature. One of the greatest gardens in the world
Well maintained and truly extraordinary. Definitely a site worth seeing, so many different plants and flowers.
We went on 31 Dec 2019. They have a Christmas theme song at the Super tree around 20:45 hrs. on the same time we went up to the skywalk. Our kid enjoy this so much.

Had a great day at this place then went back for the fantastic light show which was brilliant.unfortunatly we had a sudden downpour but it didnt spoil anything for us I especially liked the Orbs & the flower gardens

REVIEW_TITLE: Its a good walk whether you are local or foreign. As long as you like nature!
REVIEW_BODY: Both flower dome and the forest dome offer very different experience but both of them offer a walk to the nature without the hassle of walking too much. Personally, I love the flower dome more than the forest dome as the flower dome smell very nice with all the different fragrance from the different flowers. Imagine flower essential oil around you. If only they offer a place to take a nap or massage chair. Simply imagine the relaxation near city area.
Lovely gardens to wander around for the morning or afternoon. Done amazingly well with a great view of the city.

In flower dome nothing much to see if you are not interested in flowers. Obviously u gonna get great picture and huge verity of flowers, fragrance and plants. Loved cloud dome though. Read timing of mist before you visit cloud dome coz it‚Äôs amazing. Have Macdonald if you wanna see some cost effective options for brunch there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful!! Must see for trips to Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely brilliant and beautiful garden. Completely recommend visiting here. It‚Äôs free entry but you have to pay to go in the domes or the skywalk but I would say it‚Äôs worth it to get the most out of your visit.
Really beautiful place with amazing flowers and shrubs , we took the tour which was only ¬£8 each but gave us a lot of information .

REVIEW_TITLE: Great attraction, and lovely christmas market!
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay has always been a great place to visit, especially during times where there might be events, such as the christmas market during the end of the year.

Totally breathtaking creative space. Absolutely worth spending time here. We loved the fantasy garden the perfume colour and shapes are wonderful. We would happily return. The creators deserve credit for their inventiveness.

The Gardens by the Bay were lovely. We visited in Dec so brought tickets for both domes and the Winter Wonderland. The domes were spectacular and truly amazing and the gardens themselves were lovely. We were not impressed with the Winter Wonderland and it wasn‚Äôt clear from the booking that we had to collect our tickets for this from a specific collection point rather than the normal ticket booths or that this was an evening only event. The gardens themselves also needed more signs of where different parts were and it was not clear on booking that the walkway between the trees was only available at certain times.
These gardens are a must to see for all visitors to Singapore and they were amazing, but some improvement in the organisation is needed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the visit, worth the time. Definently a must see
REVIEW_BODY: WE visited all of the enclosed gardens plus a walk through the outside. Well worth the time and effort. amazing views, and a huge variety of plants and flowers. The christmas exhibts were nice also.
First thing in the morning or the light show at night this is an amazing site so much to see what a great attraction

We were pleasantly surprised to see that entry to the gardens was free. You only need to pay if you with to enter one or both of the specialist domes. It is really quite a relaxing experience walking around the various themed sections. We used the ferry bus to go around the complex which costs $8 S and provides a first class commentary explaining each of the themed regions.

Well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect place if you like colors and greenery
REVIEW_BODY:
It s huge garden place just walking distance from Marina Bay Sands. All the plants here are live and healthy.
if the day is hot i would suggest to take a hat or an umbrella. the place is good for nature lovers to stroll around or sit and relax.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not on a very humid and hot day
REVIEW_BODY:
We went here on a very bad day, it was hot and humid and it was tiring. The only thing I wanted was to escape someplace with A.C.
We went though the domes as fast as we could. The gardens are still amazing, everything is very beautiful.
I recommend not getting tickets with klook in advance because they are for the day you chose and if the weather doesn't allow you to do something, you cannot do the activity some other time or get a refund... The day we were there, there was supposed to be a storm so the walking bridge attraction was closed...
We went back here on a different day when it was cloudy and the weather was nice, we explored the place without buying any tickets, spent around 3 hours just walking around and seeing all the free areas, and it was so much better than the first day.
Another recommendation go there in the afternoon so you can catch the lights, we went around 2pm and finished before sunset, but maybe it was because of the hot weather.
Amazing place a must see if in Singapore üá∏üá¨ gardens & domes are breathtaking, we went up the observation deck too. The light shows were awesome.
We had a lovely early evening visit, great quick dinner at Satay By The Bay then the light show at the Supertree Grove. Well worth the visit at this excellent public facility.

We spent about four hours at this marvelous park, seeing orchids, the flower dome, cloud forest and supertrees. The skywalk is definitely worth the extra 8 bucks. Walked thru the Marina Sands and caught a cab up to Maxwell food market for a late lunch and then wandered thru Chinatown. Great afternoon!

What an amazing place. The kids loved the playground and the water play area. Grown ups too. Could easily stay for a good part of the day just checking it all out and will definitely go back. We didn‚Äôt go into any of the pay attractions this time around and the kids 8, 4, 3, years) were happy to just run around in the free play areas. Definitely make this a spot on your itinerary!

For the price of admission to the various attractions within the park, I don‚Äôt think it was worth. Everything was a bit underwhelming. Maybe just a walk in the park would be a better choice. You can walk around the bay which is pleasant.

What an amazing place to spend a couple hours out of the heat. The huge variety of plants from around the world, the special displays, and breathtaking views make this a must visit! It made me ditch my other summer plans and start reworking my gardens at home!
What can I say but gorgeous. This place was amazing and the exhibits were just stunning. A must see for anyone travelling to Singapore.
Worth a visit, always changing displays, water fountains, places to eat sculptures, easy access to station although can be a long walk.
This place was amazing and my family was really enjoyed. If you want to visit Singapore üá∏üá¨ and looking for one of the tourist spot this place was really recommend.

At night the area takes on a magical feel with music and lights show, best viewed on the grass lying down. Only downside was the catering facility, a giant food hall with so many choices and tables difficult to get meal in time our tour allowed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place but need to be maintained
REVIEW_BODY: I've been 2 times visit this place and i can say i love this place. It was nice during my visit on December with the Christmas decoration. But, the plants and flower a bit withered, also nothing different since my previous visit on 2016.

Depending of the time you visit (we were here on a Friday night and on a Saturday) the place might feel a little bit too packed.

It has a fantastical feel to it and even more so after sunset.
We had a great time browsing the beautiful flower gardens with enjoying the air conditioning. And the light show every night was good too!

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Fantasy, Cloud Forest and Flower Graden Dome
REVIEW_BODY: We bought the $45 ticket that included the shuttle to and from the shuttle pick up/drop off near the ticket booth, if it s a hot sunny day then this is the way to go as walking around in the 30) deg heat is exhausting. The Flower Fantasy is completely artificial (with real flowers mostly) but breathtakingly beautiful. Loved the Cloud Forest with the high sky walks and waterfalls, the Flower Dome next door was my least favorite but that said, don't miss it, it is still a stunning exhibition of a vast array of plants. Would like to see the night lights show next time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the bay at Christmas
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the gardens in early December and tried to purchase tickets to walk in the upper areas however we were informed that due to threat of lightning it was closed and if it was to reopen we would have to purchase an extra ticket at 28sd for the Christmas experience....this wasn‚Äôt advertised on their website.

Definitely spend and afternoon here and watch the sunset and light show that follows. It amazing and definitely worth it but get down early before sunset to get a decent seat somewhere.
We didn't go up on the walk as it didn't seem to offer anything you could see from MBS or another Hotel.
Public garden located near MRT station. Combined with beautiful light show. Must prepare to walk to enjoy sightseeing unless you must pay extra for tram

The art exhibits outside change every so often. The flora is spectacular. Day and night are both definitely worth doing. Entry is free but there are additional entry costs to go into some of the activities (the domed buildings and the tree top walk) and they are well worth the money. Not very costly but definitely worth it.

Allow a minimum of half a day - very busy, lots of walking, plenty of places to eat and drink. Begin with the two domes both of which are comfortably cooled. The Flower Dome, a huge greenhouse with exotic plants / trees from around the world - mediterranean to arid climates, beautiful driftwood sculptures and garden settings. Walk over to the Cloud Forest take the lift to the top and meander down through the mist whilst looking at ferns, orchids, lilies, carnivorous plants and past the 30metre indoor waterfall. Then there are the Supertrees up to 50metres tall. Vertical gardens showing orchids, bromeliads, climbers all magnificent. Walk on the OCBC Skyway which connects two of the trees, a great place for photographs. Finally the Garden Rhapsody Light Show in the Grove - just lovely.

We had this on our to do list and almost didn‚Äôt get around to it after a LONG day at Universal.

Happy we pushed through and made the effort as enjoyed by all. Take a blanket if you worried about laying down on floor - much more enjoyable than staring upwards for 15 minutes which will give you a sore neck.

This is an awesome experience that you should put on your itinerary when you visit Singapore, especially when you go with kids or teenagers. For me, this visit was enlighting and giving a new perspective that science and technology can make our great nature even more WOW (a.k.a jaw dropping, LOL).
This area is quite huge and perhaps need "strategy" so you can use your time wisely and get everything=)
If the weather is good, I suggest you to go around the park first and explore the outdoor area..because the two domes (include the pathways) are totally indoor so no worries with the rain.
All the outdoor area is free to explore..no charge..But for two domes they charge entrance ticket and another charge for observation deck+OCBC skyways.
If you are too tired to walk, the outdoor area can be explored by shuttle car that costs SGD8/1 round trip, but me myself prefered to explore the park on foot. You'll have more time to oberserve and find a lot of photo-shoot spots while walking around. But if you go by shuttle, they provide a recording tape that will give you explanation about the garden. In here, you can see heritage gardens, sun pavilion (cactus) and supertrees while walking around.
After going around the outdoor areas, perhaps you can enter the observation deck and OCBC skyways, because they will close earlier than the domes. But in this visit, I didn't buy the ticket for observation deck & OCBC skyways, so I can't tell you a lot about this..may be next time I'll visit =)
After finished observing the outdoor area, I had lunch first before entering the domes. I would recommend to eat beef & prawn satay at Satay by The Bay. It tastes good, good portion, extra juicy meat and not so expensive. SGD7 for 10 beef satay & SGD2/each prawn satay. The prawn is quite big and juicy. My kids love the prawn very much.. If you don't want to be too full, you can eat with rice cake/"lontong" (in Malay/Indonesian language) that costs SGD1/small square piece. But if you think you need more carb, maybe better if you just buy rice on other stall and you'll get more by paying the same amount. You can also try water chestnut for the drink, and refreshing tropical fruit for your dessert.
After finished my refreshing lunch, I went to the domes. There are 2 domes, the Flower Domes and the Cloud Forest Dome. I entered the Cloud Forest Dome first...From the first time the entrance door was opened, a huge tall indoor waterfall welcomed me..and it's really a jaw-dropping moment=) I think that is one of the wow-factor of this spot. Perhaps you need to bring jacket, because it's a bit cold inside (even the tap water is cold) and a bit splashy if you take photo near the fall. I was mesmerized by the building structure, how they pump gallons of water all the time to make the man-made waterfall looks alive! and how they use sun panel on the supertree top to make everything works. How smart is the creator of this place!!
This dome is bigger than the Flower Dome..you need to walk on several floors to explore all, but don't worry they have lift too and it is totally accessible for wheel chair and baby stroller. They have waterfall observation deck, the lost world zone (full of mist and you can see carnivore plants), stalagmits collection, orchids, and several unique displays & sculptures from many countries. They even have a lego flowery pond =)
After finished with the Cloud Forest Dome, we went into Flower Dome. There are so many collection of trees and flowers that are arranged to certain theme. The theme will change due to certain period. If the weather is good, you can see the sunset from here too..
The collection of the plants are so many and various and they do alive!! Imagine that many kinds of plants that usually live in different types of habitat can live in one same place.. They put complete explanation on a board in front of every plants. There are several sculpture from stem and roots and they were amazing artwork.
In my visit on January, they were in changing process from Christmas theme to Dahlia (Chinese New Year) theme..The Dahlia will be fully displayed on Jan 17 (if I'm not mistaken). But the existing flower arrangement is still even great for me=) We took several photos in front of the themed garden before leaving this dome.
Then here comes the dinner time.. I chose to eat at Pollen. I recommend you to eat here because it's very near to Supertree..so in case you bring children like me..you know, they eat so slow =) so, if they can't finished their meal before the Supertree Light Show, you can watch while you eat =) There are several restaurants that you can pick here, such as Vietnamese Pho, Japanese, Singaporean chicken/pork rice, Texas fried chicken..at that time I tried the Japanese food and it's so yummy...SGD10-12 for one menu. The portion is quite big, I can not finished myself =) If you want complete menu just add few dollars and you'll have miso soup, 2 slices of watermelon and salad. Bring your tumbler and tap water is free all over the park if you want to save money =)
Then here it is..the closing for this day..the light show...it started on 7.45 p.m and last for around 15min. It great to see the light on supertrees flipping following the music and it's a good photo-shoot spot too with the lighted supertrees behind you..=) you can see the lighted singapore flyer and marina bay sands too from here. In case you missed the show, you can wait for the next show on 8.45 p.m.
What a tired but joyful day exploring this garden. Hopefully you'll have same experience as I did =)

It was raining when we visited for the first time but we still managed to see most of the gardens. One can visit the cloud dome and another large dome for a fee, but it is worth the cost as the gardens are free. The large structures with plants growing up them are impressive. You can also go on high walkway between the structures. When we visited there was a Christmas theme in the gardens. We did prefer the gardens in the evening when the structures are lit up as the gardens sparkle and it looks totally different.

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting but not as good as Jewel Changi Airport
REVIEW_BODY: Interesting but not as good as Jewel Changi Airport, Jewel is free of charge and in my opinion much better than Gardens by the Bay, also has several hundred shops and eateries. such an amazing place. also the paid electric transfer bus at Garden by the bay is a ripoff

The gardens are wonderful and the indoor glasshouses are a treat not to be missed. We bought the three deal package and two of them were brilliant, especially the Clouds one and Floral with the 4d ride at the end as a dragonfly view.

If you are expecting natural within the biomes then this won't be for you. Lots of interesting plants and sculptures. This is manicured but beautifully presented and the plants are exceptional.especially loved the planted wall with waterfalls. Worth the price for the tickets .. be aware the gardens change leading up to Christmas, some areas aren't accessible due to Christmas shows but we still walked around a huge area. Night time when it is lit up shows these gardens to their best advantage.

REVIEW_TITLE: Extra star for light and sound show
REVIEW_BODY:
I found it overrated.

The cloud forest is good but flower dome can definitely be skipped. There are many flowers , many many species from all over the world but it is nothing compared to a natural garden. So paying 28SGd was totally a rip off

Best thing was the light and sound show in the evening by the Supertrees.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay at Christmas
REVIEW_BODY: Pretty crowded and over the top Christmas decorations in addition to the normal gardens. I think I would prefer it during a regular time instead of Christmas.
Great outdoor gardens, the indoor waterfall garden was astonishing, the flower garden not so much. Plenty of different places to look. Needed more than an afternoon. Spectacular at night.

REVIEW_TITLE: The evening light show is a must
REVIEW_BODY: We went to the evening light show in the gardens, it is absolutely spectacular. It lasts about 20 minutes, the towers lights are coordinated in tune with the classical music being played. In what is a fantastic setting these structures look even more amazing with the light show. You must go, it‚Äôs like nothing else you have ever seen.

The two domes are extraordinary and worth a visit. We went whilst it was pouring rain outside and was an ideal way to spend an afternoon. If you don‚Äôt want to spend money the garden themselves are lovely - no cost and worthwhile to go at night to see the free light show. We finished off a great night by visiting the satay stalls.

These gardens are absolutely incredible. this place is a must see. we visited Singapore for a week and went to the gardens a few times. they are worth the trip. when its day time you can enjoy all the beautiful and rear vegetation and flower and the incredible structures the domes and the supertree groves. at night you will love the amazing light show its spectacular. everything is lit and they do a musical light show twice every evening. we stayed for both show because its just so awesome! you will need a few hours for this so if you can only go once make sure you go at around 4pm so you'll be able to enjoy the place at day time and see the light show in the evening after the sun goes down.

My college teen and I spent time in both the day and went back at night if you can only see it once, go at night, spectacular. There's a lot to see here, tickets are available on the day of only not in advance. It's was quiet during the day but at night it all comes alive. There are several restaurants and seasonal events, Great place for the anyone to visit.
Fantastic option - highly recommend checking out the gardens, whoever you are. The night show is free and really very cool.

This attraction is pretty busy most of the time I would imagine but so well worth getting there. The gardens are spacious and the domes are beautifully designed. There is a lot of walking though so be prepared.

While in Singapore try visit the garden a great way to spend 4/5 hours
As well as the grounds, the sky walk, the pavilion are amazing
We enjoyed the christmas set up during the festive period. Not easy to create an authentic look and feel, but they did a great job

Both the glass domes were fantastic. Particularly due to the air conditioning.
The exhibits were 1st rate.
The staff on hand were knowledgeable and helpful and went out of their way to make sure we saw everything.
The outside gardens too are spectacular as long as you can bear the heat.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay was fantastic! We went during the day and enjoyed the lush settings and interesting art installations and at night the light show is magical and not to be missed. We loved it so much we went two nights in a row!
The cloud forest dome was well worth a visit (we didn‚Äôt do the flower one) and we happily whiled away half a day looking at the koi carp and other attractions scattered about this huge expanse of manicured brilliance. A must do if you are visiting.

REVIEW_TITLE: Well worth a look, but tiring walking around in the heat
REVIEW_BODY: Probably best to travel early to avoid the heat. The cloud garden was nice and cool. The restaurant was reasonable

Gardens by the Bay is well worth the cost, which I consider to be minimal. We only did the Cloud Walk I believe it was called - dome and it was absolutely amazing. I'm not a fan of heights but the tree top walk was fantastic, the flowers and plants all combine to completely distract you from any fear of heights. The audio visual presentation at the end of the tour is confronting and left me in tears at what we humans have done and are doing to the planet. I thoroughly recommend this to anyone and everyone.

There is no cost to walking around the Gardens by the Bay exterior gardens.

The Dome Gardens have an entry cost for each separate dome.
Purchase your trolley cart bus ride ticket at this time

Flower Dome: Was decorated in all its Christmas glory.
Christmas Nordic Gnome Themed scenarios everywhere.
Everyone was oohing & aahing as they walked around

Cloud Forest Dome: the minute you walk in and see the waterfall in all its glory.
There are different levels in this dome with different experiences and views of the dome's floral and fauna species
There are great garden sculptures and phenomenal driftwood carved sculptures.
This dome is worth experiencing!

The Super Grove Light Show:
Get there early and claim a place to sit
Many people lay on the concrete beneath the tree structures waiting for the light show
The light show is approx 15 mins long. The lights and lasers are in sync with the music
It was an awesome show and experience. I thoroughly enjoyed it.....Don't miss it!

After the light show there are huge crowds all walking back towards the city.
Get to the Trolley Cart bus quickly and queue for the bus (if you purchased a ticket) Its a quick couple of minute ride instead of walking back in the crowds.

We really enjoyed our visit. I recommend going first thing in the morning before it gets too crowded. While there were a lot of people there, we never felt too overwhelmed by a crowd. We loved the Cloud Forest and walking at the top of the Supertrees. The weather was perfect during our visit, so the heat wasn't an issue, though having a layer in the Cloud Forest is a good idea. We also enjoyed lunch in the food court. Like all of Singapore, it's fairly expensive, but we got a discount with our boarding passes from Singapore Air (and there are other ways to get a little bit off the price). Definitely recommend!

no words needed must go place/ dont hesitate to get into the gardens for extra price
be there at evening for the great show
Returning after a four year break did not disappoint. The wow was equal if not better. The development of the planting was staggering.
My family went there and get wet in pools area, it's very nice for our child. You can directly go there by MRT.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lot of walking and cold afternoon!!
REVIEW_BODY:
As we walked in to the Garden by the Bay, we purchased the ticket to get into three arena. Waterfall, cloud Forrest and Floral Fantasy.

There are lot for the flowers in Floral Fantasy. But they are not that great, as they all indoor. So we didn‚Äôt spent too much time in here, so we quickly go to the Cloud Forrest. That was very chills due to the water fall when we walked in. These two arena all pretty cold. As due to Dec weather in Sing is pretty wet. So the whole indoor AC make the whole atmosphere like Autumn. That was nice for us to kill the whole hot afternoon. Good to be hang around there.

Singapore is a great place to break a long journey. I have spent a few days in Singapire on two occasions and was never disappointed with my decision.
The gardens by the bay have their own separate beauty by day and by night.
The place has an ever changing display of flowers from around the world. Access is easy.
Thank you Singapore.
Very creative idea of creating a flower garden and cloud forest out of nowhere... beautiful concept and worth a visit

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing display - a burst of greenery to enjoy
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely scenic area with great views everywhere. Expect a lot of people everywhere taking as many selfies as possible but once you get past all them you have an amazing view and displays to see. Recommend getting the combined ticked for all the displays and trees as much more economical and worthwhile.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome place to learn world flora and climate
REVIEW_BODY: I love the cloud forest and the flower garden. Both were well designed and plenty of photo opportunities. Both provided learning and a relaxing atmosphere to wander around. Great testimony of Singapore design. Cloud forest had strong environmental emphasis. This could be better balanced.
Free twice nightly light show absolutely fantastic! Set to music and must be watched from underneath
A nice botanic walk with a range of beautiful flowers. We got this in a package that included the Cloud Forest.

This is a beautiful place to visit but really packed in the evenings with long queues for everything. Allow yourself much more time than you think you need. The flower dome was a bit underwhelming but the cloud forest a bit better. The food court is always very busy so we never eat here. I think this place is best for a leisurely stroll when you have a lot of time and you don‚Äôt want to go to any of the paid attractions like the sky walk, etc.

A little over rated if I'm being honest. Sure, the gardens are lovely and the light show over the super trees are pretty decent but not on a par with Bellagio in Vegas.
If you are in the area, go. If not - dont go out of your way, you're really not missing out on much

I got there at about 5pm which was good timing. By the time I walked around and went through Flower Dome and Cloud Forest, it was dark and the place just lit up. Even if you just walk around at dark, it is such a beautiful sight to witness. So glad I went.

The Amazon orchid section in the flower dome was the best part. It needs more than 2.5 hours to have a good experience of the garden. I went at 5:00 but couldn‚Äôt see the light show which starts at 7:30.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awful in the rain! Christmas Wonderland it wasn‚Äôt.
REVIEW_BODY:
We were in Singapore for two days before Christmas, and having read all hype about the Christmas wonderland, we thought it would be a nice thing to take our kids to (ages 5 and 7). We pre-booked tickets for entry, the sky walk and a magic show by Vitaly.

We arrived around 5, just in time for the drizzle. Singapore is not exactly rain-shy, so to be told that the OCBC sky walk was shut because of the rain was disappointing to say the least. In theory, we could have exchanged our tickets for another day, but as we were leaving the next morning, this wasn‚Äôt an option for us.

It turns out that Christmas wonderland is about as exciting as the inside of a paper bag in the daylight, and even less so in the rain. Great! So we headed over to the flower dome, but the queue was so ridiculous that we didn‚Äôt have time to visit before the magic/illusion show was scheduled to begin.

At this point, the rain was beginning to pick up. We headed back towards the theatre, at the other end of the park. As the rain became torrential, the covered walkway ended, and we had to run through puddles and rain to get to the theatre - again, rain is not uncommon in Singapore, and at other times, the sun is incredibly strong, so why not design a sheltered walkway??

We bought tokens to use the miniature train, which you can take over to the theatre, but it was soooooo slow, only one of the two trains was running and it only takes 8 people in the rain. It seemed to take around 30minutes to make a round trip, so even with a short queue, it quickly became apparent that this wasn‚Äôt an option.

Anyway, we braved the rain and arrived at the theatre, and grabbed some seats. We watched Vitaly‚Äôs promo video, which showed us his signature trick of producing a rose from what had started as a blank piece of paper. A nice trick, but why, when he came on stage, did we then get to see it twice more in his 30minute set? Even the kids were pretty underwhelmed.

After the show, the rain had stopped. Having bought the non-refundable fairground tokens for the train, the kids then went on a couple of rides. They were very tame, and eye-wateringly expensive - $8 per child for a three minute go on the swings.

Still soggy, we ultimately decided to skip the light show as we had heard the taxi queues afterwards can be horrendous and the kids were beginning to get hungry, so we headed back into Singapore. There is a food court at the gardens, but this was also rammed with long queues, and nowhere to sit.

All in all a huge, expensive disappointment.

Gardens by the Bay is a free or pay attraction. Most of the area is free like the outdoor gardens under the Supertrees and Children‚Äôs Garden at Bay South. There are multiple pathways with foliage. You can pay standard rates for the two conservatories, Floral Fantasy, OCBC Skyway, and Supertree Observatory. Each have a separate admission or purchase an attraction bundle which includes shuttle service. OCBC Skyway and Supertree Observatory are not part of the bundle. We took the free route and didn‚Äôt pay for anything. After visiting the Singapore Botanical Gardens a few hours before, we couldn‚Äôt imagine seeing anything more beautiful. There are plenty of bathrooms and a few places to eat throughout.
Make sure to visit gardens by the bay! It was a very interesting visit and we saw hundreds of different plants flowers and trees.
This is another "must do" when in Singapore. Both the Gardens by the Bay and the Cloud Garden are superb. Allow plenty of time to do both.

This year's flower dome deco is very nice. This is our annual visit during Christmas to enjoy the wonderful place and taking a lot of photos. However on the day, I felt very sick and vomiting. Your group of staffs very helpful to assist me whatever I need and arrange ambulance sent me to hospital. I am here to say big thank you to all of your staffs.

Wife is orchids lovers, it's our anniversary
got no time to give her a surprise, bought the tickets online
she loves it, unforgettable memory

If you go to Singapore you have to see it.
Not something spectacular but, very clean considering the flows all the day.
We been there for X-mas and I can say if you have kids they will be very impressed with the X-mas decoration and the crowd around gives the feeling of X-mas and family.
Everything is indoor but the AC a bit strong, so you feel good and can spend few hours around.
Beautiful night show with American Christmas music playing to synchronized lights. They had several shows each evening.

We went here at night hoping to shoot the Trees and found that they were shut off to highlight the Christmas structures that they erected.

The Christmas decor were nice too but I was a bit disappointed because I was looking forward to shoot the lighted trees.

The whole place is amazing because of the lights display. They are open until around 2 in the morning.

The pond with big eggs with changing lights was also a sight to see.

REVIEW_TITLE: Mother Nature is a real pleasure.
REVIEW_BODY: I am not all that enhusiastic about gardens and plants but this is a must see for any visitor to Singapore. It's constructed somewhat in the style of a Disney park with rolling hills and various plant settings and artistic designs. It adjoins another equally fascinating building that leads to a rainforest setting. The visit to the top of that one is the most thrilling.
Great place for plants and flowers lover. I really loved the super tree walkway was worth the wait beautiful views.
Just wonderful what they have done here. Am sure some of the species here are exclusive. Great tour to relax for some.
Lots of queues,but move fas t,well worth the wait ,lots of walking, hustle and bustle,some lovely plants and sculptures
Wow is all I can say to describe this. It truly is an awe inspiring event. Make sure to go in the evening and catch the lights.

I have to confess that I‚Äôm not the greatest fan of visiting a garden. However, anyone in the world, no matter how skeptical or blas√©, will find something to be impress by, while visiting this yet another amazing achievement of the Singaporean government of which visionary endeavors don‚Äôt cease to surprise me.
If it‚Äôs not the meticulous achievement to gather all these plants and trees from around the globe under one (huge!) roof or the care for them, it has to be the technical aspects of building and maintaining the largest unsustained greenhouse in the world.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Befitting Beauty Spot on Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY:
Brilliant Brilliant Brilliant !

This man-made master piece lives up to the the hype and offers a beautiful experience worth the lifetime.

The Musical Light Show is spectacular and if you fail to get a ticket (limited tickets makes it impossible to accommodate everyone so please book it way in advance) to observe it from the viewing deck

The light show takes place twice every night and is on for 15 minutes. The first show is on at 7:45pm and the second is on at 8:45pm. An extra show on Holidays is added, for which you'll have check on their official website (usually a 9.45pm show) .

There are many spots to see this beauty but our favorite (and Highly recommended) was to lie down on the concrete circles supporting the Garden Towers called Super tree Groves an hour prior to the show as they fill-in fast.

Others being:

From above, on the skywalk of Marina Bay Sands Hotel, decent view minus the music

On the promenade by the Dragonfly Lake, at the park entrance between Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay.

The Deck / Skywalk exactly above the public loo overlooking the Super tree Groves (have some steps to climb up)

Other than that there are observatories like Cloud Forest, Flower Forest Dome which are worth the dime.

Numerous sculptures and and arts installed in beautiful corners are worth enjoying.

Restaurants are plenty but standards aren't that great so would suggest to stick to McDs in the Garden.

This is a "must see" for any visitor, young and old, to Singapore. By constantly creating new attractions, Singapore is re-inventing itself and continues to make itself attractive to tourists and locals alike. Some of the displays are themed according to country and by season. For the happy snapper there are ample opportunities for group photographs and selfies. Most amazing was the 3D cinema with realistic effects to capture the imagination, and the gigantic waterfalls that cascade spectacularly down to a rain forest. A glass-enclosed venue ensures one can enjoy the visit despite the weather outside. Well worth it!

Really worth going to. Best to go in the afternoon and stay till the evening. Tickets are confusing. For the skywalk if you have tickets you need to get a time slot as well We timed it well for 740pm and were up there to see the light show at 745pm. Then we walked over to the laser show in front of the Marina sands hotel. I liked the cloud garden the best. We ate at Satay Bay nice local food.

Beautiful is the first word that comes into mind. You can see the care and time they took out to make the experience a must do. We returned later that night for the light show which was also a great experience. Most of it is air-conditioning so you are very comfortable no matter what the outside climate. MUST DO

I am not interested in gardening by any means, however these gardens are nothing short of amazing. You will be pleasantly surprised at the structure itself and how they maintain these beautiful gardens.

The waterfall is definitely a must see.
A Christmas Wonderland was running while we were the in December. Lovely atmosphere with a European type Christmas market. Gardens are beautiful and Christmas time made it very special.
Incredible. Wow at every turn. Fantastic value for money. Great day out. Could easily spend all day and all night here.

We went during Christmas. Christmas wonderland was superb... everything was so amazing about this place. Very well organized. You can't miss going here. Always visit the domes first and then go to the trees. The light show is beautiful

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens and Satay by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: We enjoyed a pleasant Sunday evening visit to the Gardens by the Bay with an hour at the hawker stalls at Satay by the Bay. No real queues. If you are intending to visit more than once, then perhaps buy an annual pass. Highlights for us were the last day of the Christmas display, seeing a lizard swimming in the bay (no it wasn‚Äôt an otter!), reasonable food at the hawker market. Don‚Äôt go there just for the food. There are better hawker markets, but the overall gardens experience, as the lights come on around 7.30 is very worthwhile.

We visited the gardens at night to get most of the light show, which is beautiful. The light show takes place every 45 mins and it gets very busy. Best way to see it is to find a spot in the middle of the tree sculptures and lay down on the floor. You can walk around a lot of the gardens free of charge, any attractions such as the viewing platform, sky bridge, cloud dome or flower dome are extra charge. If bought together, it‚Äôs cheaper.
Just an amazing place. Cloud Forest and the Flower Domes are fantastic! Then you have to stay to see the nightly tree of lights display

I went with my wife after the plane flight.Even though we were tired im glad we went.The gardens are magnificent and it makes you wonder how can such a place coexist with the bank scyscapers just a few blocks from there.A great collection of flora and the great solar plants are a sight especially in the night.Visit cloud forest.The best part was the fortunate fact that we happened to visit the marina at the digital arts exhibition with the eggs that changed color.It was magic..
Fabulous time spent in the Cloud Forrest and Flower Dome, highly recommend. Superb variety of plants and flowers.

Make sure you don't miss the nightly tree of lights show at the Gardens by the Bay. 15 mins of choreographed music and lights - two showings per night, 7.45pm and 8.45pm. We were there at Christmas time so winter wonderland type fayre also present. Gardens by the Bay is a must for any visitors

They are just not a gardens. It‚Äôs a well planned out fantastic display. Could easily spend hours and hours walking and looking at everything. The night time light show was spectacular and we were up on the walk during it- truly amazing!

Irrespective if you're a nature lover or not, this is a "must see" on your visit to Singapore. Various themes inspired by country and season and expressed via floral arrangements made for captivating viewing and will keep your camera snapping. Visual 3D cinema was made even more realistic and I won't spoil the surprise for future visitors. Domed building housing exotic plants, sky-scraping waterfalls, amazing displays are a feast to the eye. Worth a second visit anytime.

Gardens by the Bay is one of the must watch attractions in Singapore. They have a supertree observatory, flower dome & cloud forest which one can pay a visit to.

Really nice pictures can be taken. Do not miss out on the spectra light show which happens every night at 8 & 9.

We enjoyed our time at Gardens by the Bay, in particular the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome. Beautiful displays, walks and amazing plants from all around the world. Well worth the visit. Very enjoyable indeed.
Absolutely astounding! I went 2 nights in a row as I was totally enamoured by the beautiful gardens. The light show cannot be missed! Such an incredible sight in an incredible city!
Very nice, impressive, the gardens are also good idea for rainings days, a place you must visit in singapore.
Nice place to relax and get away a bit from the city. Many good place to visit. Note though that the food around here is really bad and extensive so either eat beforehand or bring a snack.
Really BREATHTAKING !!!! at night with the lights. maintained very well & must visit. the Flower dome is awesome.

It was a marvelous experience to visit Gardens By the Bay. Its a must visit for an extraordinary experience of plants world. There is a lot to see and learn. Also, the entire place is so well done up and tourist friendly.

REVIEW_TITLE: Sky Walk poorly managed - YOU NEED A TIME CODE
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay is impressive, although i'd only go once.
I'd definitely say it's worth it and you should go. This review is nothing on the gardens itself, but more for the management to read and to give people a heads up.
The skywalk part is managed terribly - there is no signage or clues to tell people who have waited in a 30 minutes line, that once they get to the front, they have to go find another stall to buy yet another ticket, and get their time stamp to do the skywalk.
I saw over 50+ people get frustrated about this and the staff don't do anything to change it or feel no remorse - It is not hard to change this and make it clear to people who visit that they need a time code before queing up, as they then have to queue for that, and then the line they just waited in. Complete waste of everyone's time - i am so surprised no one in the staff has reported this or there's been no change after a year of seeing this happen day in and day out. Someone please take initative.
This was our 3rd visit and although we went during the busy time- staff were helpful and the environment was buzzing.

This has to be on everyone's list when you visit Singapore. Simply stunning. The two domes were the highlight. Best to see after dark when the lights come alive. Would definitely do again on my next trip

Went directly to the Cloud Forest, which was lovely experience. Lots of flowers, plants, trees and a magnificent water fall. Easy to walk around with kids. Costs 12 SD for a kid and 20 SD for an adult. Worth visiting. Apparently you need to pay similar fee to the Flower Dome, but did not visit that this time.

Then to the OCBC Skyway. Last time you get up there is at 9PM and you will need to get a time slot from the ticket booth after 7.30PM. The light show will be at 19.45 and 20.45 and we managed to see it first from the ground and then from the Skyway. Both were impressive but you get better pictures from the ground :)

Do not go up to the Skyway if you are afraid of hights!

REVIEW_TITLE: More than just the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Skyway
REVIEW_BODY:
There is more to Gardens by the Bay than the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Skyway which you have to pay to see.

There is also the gardens and Supertree Grove that you can wander around for free, many different sections and areas of the gardens to visit including the large baby and the koi fish.

Take a wander around separate to the paid tourist items, and you‚Äôll see there is lots to admire here.

Our family enjoyed the themed garden with Santa Claus mimicking Santa's Northern HQ with monitors, air-flight tracking info, and Christmas snow theme section in the middle.

Picture spots
The singing gnomes at the end =)
The window sill/bench overlooking the bridge
The Garden walkways overlooking different points

The Gardens by the Bay is vast. There are plenty to see for fee but there are charges for the 'Flower Dome', 'Cloud Forest' and 'OCBC Sky Way'. All of them are worth seeing. See my comments on each one separately. It is very relaxing and plenty of areas to have a small picnic.

There are light shows in the evening about 8.00pm is first session then 10.00pm last shows. ( I think). Please check out the time as it may varies at different time of the year.
It is impressive and free.

The nearest MRT is BayFront.

It is a great place to visit. Highly recommended.
This place is amazing. The landscaping even includes mature trees under a huge dome. It is beautiful.

REVIEW_TITLE: It‚Äôs nice to walk around the gardens.
REVIEW_BODY: There‚Äôs a light show at night too. A lot of tourist and crowd during weekend though so getting home was quite a trouble and had to squeeze while watching the light show. Have to walk quite a distance from Marina Bay Sands too. It was quite tiring, be prepared to spend the whole day to explore the area.

We went to the Bay of Gardens on Dec 30th to see the Trees of Light ...it was stunning and to think there is no charge to see it.If you go and want to have the balcony walk you pay but be aware you have to buy a ticket for that and the tkt office closes at 8pm so get there early we missed it. ..Even though we didnt do the walk high up in the trees I think we got the best view as it was just amazing looking up at them this is one place not to miss .Again we got there to late to see the rest of the park so I would recommend going early see the other attractions in it and, have something to eat and then be ready for the lighting. When it finished we walked along the waterfront and that was another amazing colourful experience with the egg shaped things on the water going different colours then you walk across into the Marina Bay Hotel and you can do it without having to pay anything ...that was unbelievable.

What amazing gardens. Spread over a vast area you really need two days to see the whole site. The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are superb, the Sky Trees amazing and the Skyway gives you a great view across the gardens. In the evening there is a wonderful light and music show but get there early as there are big crowds for this
Amazing place a must see if you are in Singapore. Don‚Äôt miss the light show in the evening at about 1945. Go via the MRT if possible the queue for taxis in the evening was long

A feast for the senses. Top tips: 1. Allow at least 4 or 5 hours - we arrived early afternoon and went through to catch the first light show at 7.45pm and then left via the eggs on the lake - change colour and sound when touched.
2. Go to Satay by the Bay for refreshments (local and other food, including beer), much cheaper than other outlets by the Domes, and a chance for a breather.
3. If you only have time for one main thing, do the Cloud Forest - stunning.
Gardens by the bay is another Singapore must see. Amazing things to see everywhere you turn even if you are not a plant person it is spectacular

The gardens here are extensive and well worth a visit both day and night. There is lots to see so allow a day. We were really hoping to see otters, but knowing there is wildlife in such a busy, populated area is a huge bonus. Be warned, there are lots of things to see, but everything in Singapore is a money making opportunity and you will be charged

We visited the Gardens by the bay whilst in Singapore in August 2019.
We arrived early morning and walked around the gardens for a while before finding the cafe and stopping for a refreshing drink.
After a drink we then got tickets for the Skywalkway and took in the amazing views from the walkway.
After enjoying the views from the walkway we continued to explore the park we then arrived at the domes and brought tickets and did a walk around one of the Domes, as one was closed we could only visit the one, however the plants colours and displays were well set out and very interesting.
After our tour of the Dome we went to find somewhere to eat within the Gardens, we found a cafe and had something to eat then left the park late afternoon.
We really enjoyed the park although it was a very humid day, the visit to the Dome was really enjoyed as it was air conditioned and the temperature controlled.
